description:
We are currently searching for a dynamic and detail oriented individual to join Marcan Pharmaceuticals as an Artwork Coordinator with Graphic Design skills.
Marcan Pharmaceuticals Inc., located in the nation’s capital Ottawa, a company that was founded in 2005 with the vision to develop, manufacture & supply low cost, high quality finished dose generics in the Canadian marketplace. We are now part of Emcure Pharmaceuticals a global multinational company with product being sold to over 65 countries globally.
Strong organizational, communication, attention to detail and administrative skills are important. School diploma or equivalency certificate is required. Experience of 2 years in the relevant area is preferred. The job is full time permanent position.
Primary Duties & Responsibilities

 Manage the entire design life cycle from design inception to label approval to finished product label inspection
 Manage the artwork approval process for all customers that are developing their own labels
 Maintain a system for tracking artwork
 Maintain files with current deadlines and packaging configurations
 Product label creation
 Prepare and send cross license artwork for Health Canada (HC) submissions
 Updating artwork based on HC recommendations
 Coordinate with suppliers for deadlines
 Proof & Approve Marcan labels
 Maintain a database for product related codes
 Web design and maintenance
 Work with multichannel within the company to ensure communication on projects and labels timelines are understood
 Design and create marketing materials for retail use which includes but not limited to posters, online posts, trade show material
 Design and maintain company logos – Letterhead, Envelopes, business cards, Etc.
 French/English Translation

Desired Skills & Experience

 Strong organization, communication, and administrative skills
 Up to date with industry leading software and technologies (Illustrator, Photoshop mandatory)
 Collaborative attitude
 Think creatively and develop new design concepts, graphics and layouts
 Collaborate with the creative team to bring concepts and creative ideas to life
 Amend final designs to management comments and gain full approval
 Time management skills to meet deadlines on multiple projects
 Attention to detail
 Ability to keep calm and steady in a fast-changing environment is essential
 Critical thinking
 Photo editing and manipulation
 Solid understanding of print and digital production best practices
 Preparing designs for print publication
 Enthusiastic, self-motivated and has an ability to work independently.
 Has solid communication skills and is capable of working well with a wide range of people across multiple disciplines.
 Stays current and on top of new design trends.
 Able to think outside the box and offer new and unique design solutions.
 Highly creative and imaginative with strong design and interpersonal skills.
 A strong understanding of the pre-press process.
 Ability to receive constructive feedback and provide solutions that uphold the integrity of the main idea.

The above statement reflects the general details considered necessary to performance the duties of the job. This shall not be construed as a detailed description of all the requirements of the job. Only candidates with a valid work permit to work will be considered. Should you need accommodation please let the hiring manager know. We thank all applicants for their interest, however only those candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.
Job Type: Full-time
Salary: $50,000.00-$60,000.00 per year
Benefits:

 Dental care
 Extended health care
 Paid time off

Schedule:

 Monday to Friday

Supplemental pay types:

 Bonus pay

Ability to commute/relocate:

 Nepean, ON K2E 1A2: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Education:

 DCS / DEC (preferred)

Experience:

 Graphic design: 2 years (required)

Work Location: In person
Application deadline: 2023-10-20Expected start date: 2023-11-01
